function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of quality assessment of green areas in studies can lead to inconsistent evidence on the effect of green space on health outcomes.","Impact":"Limited contributions to the understanding of pathways and causalities in the relationship between green space and health.","Mitigation":"Include quality assessment of green areas in study designs to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the impact on health outcomes.","Technologies":"Geospatial technology for precise assessment of green space quality.","People":"Researchers, epidemiologists, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"},{"Description":"On-site studies may suffer from drawbacks such as time, funding, control of confounders, and small sample sizes, limiting the reliability of the findings.","Impact":"Inability to adequately assess long-term mental health outcomes and potential biases in study results.","Mitigation":"Careful consideration of study design, increased funding for on-site studies, and collaboration with relevant stakeholders to address confounding factors.","Technologies":"Advanced data collection and analysis techniques, longitudinal studies, and collaboration tools for multi-disciplinary research.","People":"Researchers, mental health professionals, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, funding agencies"},{"Description":"Laboratory experiments using visual stimuli and students as participants may not fully represent the reality of user experience in green spaces or the characteristics of the whole population.","Impact":"Limited generalizability of findings to the broader population and real-world settings.","Mitigation":"Incorporate diverse participant groups, use more immersive assessment methods, and conduct complementary field studies to validate laboratory findings.","Technologies":"Virtual reality, immersive technologies, and observational tools for field studies.","People":"Researchers, psychologists, social scientists","Owner":"Research institutions, academic institutions"}]}
